title: OpenType to TrueType?
content:
Due to an outdated form of Word on an outdated Jornada, is there any way I can change OpenType fonts to TrueType? The least expensive, the better! Thanks.

-- David
author: fathairyape

comments.content:
I presume these OpenType fonts you want to convert are PostScript-flavored (.otf extension), right? If so, I believe you can use [TransType](http://web.archive.org/web/20110606153723/http:/typophile.com/wiki/TransType).

If the OpenType fonts are TrueType-flavored (.ttf extension), then you shouldn't have any problems, as these are supposed to be backward compatible.

formlos: Thanks, great links!  
Miguel Sousa: Exactly :). I meant the .otf extension, sorry. I keep forgetting to clarify :D.  
-- David
